summary: The document is a memorandum from J B Finnegan to the Director of the FBI, dated March 8, 1967, concerning Robert Scheer. It seeks any reports on Scheer following a previous report by Special Agent William E. Hughes and questions the FBI's objection to further processing of the case, which might result in a field board action involving Scheer. Additionally, it requests that correspondence be sent through the FBI Liaison Representative to the Personnel Security Division of the Department of the Army.
key_findings: The document is connected to the JFK assassination system and involves a request for information on Robert Scheer.
It mentions previous reports and memorandums about Scheer from 1966.
The case could lead to a field board action involving Scheer, hinting at possible security concerns or investigations.
Marked as unclassified but released with deletions, indicating some sensitive information was redacted.
